titles: The faithful shepherdess Relating how a young maid by her constant love, turned the heart of a faithful lover: who seeing the truth of her affections, after a tedious absence, came and married her, and liv'd very happily with her. To a very new tune: or, Farewel fair Armeda: or, Captain Digby's Farewel.
publisher: printed for Phillip Brooksby, next door to the ball in West-smithfield,
notes: Date of publication from Wing CD-ROM, 1996.
Verse - "Amintas was walking one evening alone".
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, England.
keywords: Love poetry, English --  England --  Early works to 1800.
